title: EU proposes moratorium on PTA, till new law comes
byline: The European Union (EU) has inquired about a possible moratorium on the invocation of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) until it is repealed to be replaced by a new anti-terrorism law, but the government has not yet discussed it, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Handing over PCOL report to CID is an eye wash: Kavinda
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake handing over the report of the Presidential Commission which probed Easter Sunday attacks to the CID is an eye wash as it is not likely to do any good, an Opposition MP said yesterday.

title: We still have hope that truth will be revealed: Catholic Church
byline: The Catholic Church in Sri Lanka still hopes that truth behind the Easter Sunday attacks will be revealed, Member of Communications Committee Archdiocese of Colombo Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said yesterday.

title: Scientists claim to have discovered ’new colour’ no one has seen before
byline: A team of scientists claim to have discovered a new colour that no human has ever seen before.

title: Namal accuses Govt of politicising Easter attacks
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa accused the current Government of exploiting the 2019 Easter Sunday bomb attacks for political gain ahead of the Local Government elections.

title: Only 14% of ETF members active by end 2024
byline: Only 14.11 percent of member accounts in the Employees’ Trust Fund (ETF) were active at the end of 2024, according to the Central Bank (CB).

title: EPF net worth soars to Rs. 4.37 tn as real returns hit decade high
byline: Sri Lanka’s Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF), the nation’s largest retirement fund, reported a record 12.6 percent year-on-year surge in net worth to Rs. 4.37 trillion by the end of 2024, up from Rs. 3.89 trillion in 2023.

title: Official reserves jump US$ 431mn in March to US$ 6.52bn
byline: Sri Lanka experienced a notable increase in its gross official reserve assets during March 2025, primarily due to the receipt of its fourth programme tranche from the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

title: Easter Sunday’s attacks PCoI report sent to CID for probe on President’s orders
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the Secretary to the President to hand over the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) into the 2019 Easter Sunday’s attacks to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for further investigation.
